segments.text: Syntax Sunday: Channel Descriptions
segments.norm: syntax sunday: channel descriptions

segments.text: Happy Syntax Sunday. Ever dive into a fixture profile and get lost in all the channels and functions? Blackout makes that a lot easier, especially for profiles with more complex channel sets. In My Show ‚Üí Fixtures, you can tap any profile to see all its channels, parameters, and the built-in descriptions we include for functions that tend to confuse programmers. But here‚Äôs your quick tip: In Fixture Controls, you can press and hold on any channel function to instantly see its description. No digging. No guessing. Just clarity exactly where you need it. It‚Äôs a small detail, but on set, the small details are everything and this one keeps you moving fast and programming confidently. What quick tips do you want to see next? Drop them in the comments. Want to take your Blackout skills further? Tap the link in bio or visit www.blackout-app.com. Explore Blackout: Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Manual: https://docs.blackout-app.com/ Help Center: https://help.blackout-app.com/ Join the Blackout Community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp/ ============================= Ian Peterson's Links: ============================= Website: https://www.ianspeterson.com Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ian.s.peterson/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/ianpeterson #blackoutapp 00:00 ‚Äì Profile Overview 00:26 ‚Äì Pro Tip

segments.text: Streamline Your Lighting with Blackout 2.5 Defaults
segments.norm: streamline your lighting with blackout 2.5 defaults

segments.text: Blackout 2.5 introduces default presets that make your lighting workflow faster and more consistent. With defaults, you can: Save Fader Configurations ‚Äì Store fixture, sequence, group, or effect fader settings including buttons and toggle states, then apply them to new faders or all faders at once. Set Record Menu Defaults ‚Äì Pre-select options like manual values or selection-only for looks and recordings, saving time on every take. Create Favorite Presets ‚Äì Quickly record color, position, gobo, and other parameters with your preferred default selections. Labels even update automatically to match the current fixture output. Whether you‚Äôre managing a single fader or an entire rig of favorites, defaults in Blackout 2.5 streamline your setup, cut down repetitive work, and keep your workflow consistent. üí° Try setting your first default and see how much time you save! Subscribe to our Build Announcements newsletter for full release notes or join our Facebook group for community tips and updates: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp ============================ New Features üöÄ - Record DMX Input - Record live DMX Input or Output directly into your Looks and Favorites ‚Äî simply switch to the Input or Output view and record. - PATCH & Offline Docs in the About Menu - Access PATCH and the offline documentation site from the About menu (tap the Blackout logo in the top-right). - An internet connection is required to Ask Patch questions. - Improved Fixture Filtering & Manual Control - Added a toggle to the Fixtures filter and a new Manual Values button alongside Live Summary. - Enhanced Live Summary - Live Summary now displays both your current selection and virtual dimmers. - Pan / Tilt / Zoom Degree Indicators - Pan, Tilt, and Zoom values now display degree (¬∞) symbols for improved clarity. - Expanded OSC Support - Added additional OSC commands ‚Äî see the docs site for details. - Save Default Form Presets - Popup forms (Record, Update, Fader Config) can now save defaults. - Check the box next to an item and it will automatically load next time. Fixes ü©π - LivePlot now safely saves changes when the app is suspended or exited - Channel functions now snap correctly at the end of Look transitions instead of transitioning linearly - Channel function center buttons now correctly reset to a User Value of 0 - Improved text visibility on black background pillboxes - Deleting a Look now returns to the previous Look instead of advancing forward - App launch no longer causes stalls - LivePlot now targets objects by UUID (except Fixtures), allowing renaming or renumbering without breaking plots - LivePlot color calculations are now accurate - Go Fader now correctly respects wraparound behavior - Fixed crashes caused by non-English characters - Resolved encoder jumps when used with OSC or MIDI - Astera NYX bulbs now correctly support battery adjustments - Locked objects in LivePlot can still be selected (locking only affects Edit Mode positioning) - Turning off a Sequence Fader now correctly kills FX - Favorites Expanded filtering now works correctly - Updated UI on the Macro creation screen for improved clarity - Added a ‚Äústrong‚Äù Create New Macro ‚Äústrong‚Äù button to Macros Expanded Plus: Many additional fixes and performance improvements addressing edge cases, stability issues, and internal system reliability throughout the app. #blackoutapp #lightingconsole #lightingprogrammer ============================ Blackout Lighting Console Links: ============================= Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Join the Blackout Facebook User Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp Watch Blackout Breakdowns: Custom Views https://youtu.be/0Np8yiIEavU ============================= Ian Peterson's Links: ============================= Website: https://www.ianspeterson.com Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ian.s.peterson/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/ianpeterson

segments.text: Blackout Update: Better Live Summary Features
segments.norm: blackout update: better live summary features

segments.text: Live Summary in Blackout just received some major workflow upgrades, and they‚Äôre all about keeping your view focused and your controls easier to manage on set. If you‚Äôre not familiar, Live Summary shows you every light with a dimmer value above zero, perfect for template files or large patches where only a few fixtures are actually in use. In this update, Live Summary gets even more powerful: - Selected lights now appear in Live Summary even if their dimmer is set to zero, allowing you to stay in Live Summary while building looks and selecting fixtures. - A new dropdown filter lets you view only lights with manual values, making it easier to filter while saving or refining a look. - Virtual dimmers are now included, so LED fixtures with virtual dimming show up correctly in Live Summary. These improvements are designed to keep your screen clean, reduce visual clutter, and help you move faster when working with large patches on set. Let us know in the comments what features or workflows you‚Äôd like to see next. You can learn more by checking out our docs site: https://docs.blackout-app.com/ Want more tips and updates? Subscribe to our Build Announcements newsletter or join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp ============================ Blackout 2.5.0 Update: New Features üöÄ - Record DMX Input - Record live DMX Input or Output directly into your Looks and Favorites ‚Äî simply switch to the Input or Output view and record. - PATCH & Offline Docs in the About Menu - Access PATCH and the offline documentation site from the About menu (tap the Blackout logo in the top-right). - An internet connection is required to Ask Patch questions. - Improved Fixture Filtering & Manual Control - Added a toggle to the Fixtures filter and a new Manual Values button alongside Live Summary. - Enhanced Live Summary - Live Summary now displays both your current selection and virtual dimmers. - Pan / Tilt / Zoom Degree Indicators - Pan, Tilt, and Zoom values now display degree (¬∞) symbols for improved clarity. - Expanded OSC Support - Added additional OSC commands ‚Äî see the docs site for details. - Save Default Form Presets - Popup forms (Record, Update, Fader Config) can now save defaults. - Check the box next to an item and it will automatically load next time. Fixes ü©π - LivePlot now safely saves changes when the app is suspended or exited - Channel functions now snap correctly at the end of Look transitions instead of transitioning linearly - Channel function center buttons now correctly reset to a User Value of 0 - Improved text visibility on black background pillboxes - Deleting a Look now returns to the previous Look instead of advancing forward - App launch no longer causes stalls - LivePlot now targets objects by UUID (except Fixtures), allowing renaming or renumbering without breaking plots - LivePlot color calculations are now accurate - Go Fader now correctly respects wraparound behavior - Fixed crashes caused by non-English characters - Resolved encoder jumps when used with OSC or MIDI - Astera NYX bulbs now correctly support battery adjustments - Locked objects in LivePlot can still be selected (locking only affects Edit Mode positioning) - Turning off a Sequence Fader now correctly kills FX - Favorites Expanded filtering now works correctly - Updated UI on the Macro creation screen for improved clarity - Added a "strong Create New Macro strong" button to Macros Expanded Plus: Many additional fixes and performance improvements addressing edge cases, stability issues, and internal system reliability throughout the app. #blackoutapp #lightingconsole #lightingprogrammer ============================ Blackout Lighting Console Links: ============================= Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Join the Blackout Facebook User Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp ============================= Ian Peterson's Links: ============================= Website: https://www.ianspeterson.com Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ian.s.peterson/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/ianpeterson

segments.text: How to Use the DMX Tester in Blackout
segments.norm: how to use the dmx tester in blackout

segments.text: Everyone‚Äôs sleeping on the DMX Tester, but it‚Äôs one of the most useful tools in Blackout for quickly testing and flashing your lights. In this quick tip, we‚Äôll walk through how to use the DMX Tester step by step: - Select your fixtures (e.g. 101 through 112) - Enable the DMX Tester to see them all turn on instantly - Use Next and Last to cycle through fixtures - Or hit Play Tester to automate the process - Adjust the timing and intensity to test your setup at your own pace It‚Äôs fast, simple, and saves tons of time when setting up or troubleshooting your rig. We use it every time we hook up lights, and you should too. Watch now and start testing your lighting setups smarter with Blackout. segments.text: Save Presets & Colors From Any Console With Blackout
segments.norm: save presets & colors from any console with blackout

segments.text: DMX recording in Blackout is here, making it easier than ever to capture presets and palettes from any console. In this video, we show you how to: - Enable DMX Input in Link Status and view incoming data - Record full looks or just specific parameters, like color - Save colors as Favorites for instant use at any intensity - Import patch information from another console directly into Blackout Whether you want to save a single color or an entire set of presets, Blackout streamlines your workflow and keeps your favorite settings ready to go. You can learn more by checking out our docs site: https://docs.blackout-app.com/ Want more tips and updates? Subscribe to our Build Announcements newsletter or join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp ============================ New Features üöÄ - Record DMX Input - Record live DMX Input or Output directly into your Looks and Favorites ‚Äî simply switch to the Input or Output view and record. - PATCH & Offline Docs in the About Menu - Access PATCH and the offline documentation site from the About menu (tap the Blackout logo in the top-right). - An internet connection is required to Ask Patch questions. - Improved Fixture Filtering & Manual Control - Added a toggle to the Fixtures filter and a new Manual Values button alongside Live Summary. - Enhanced Live Summary - Live Summary now displays both your current selection and virtual dimmers. - Pan / Tilt / Zoom Degree Indicators - Pan, Tilt, and Zoom values now display degree (¬∞) symbols for improved clarity. - Expanded OSC Support - Added additional OSC commands ‚Äî see the docs site for details. - Save Default Form Presets - Popup forms (Record, Update, Fader Config) can now save defaults. - Check the box next to an item and it will automatically load next time. Fixes ü©π - LivePlot now safely saves changes when the app is suspended or exited - Channel functions now snap correctly at the end of Look transitions instead of transitioning linearly - Channel function center buttons now correctly reset to a User Value of 0 - Improved text visibility on black background pillboxes - Deleting a Look now returns to the previous Look instead of advancing forward - App launch no longer causes stalls - LivePlot now targets objects by UUID (except Fixtures), allowing renaming or renumbering without breaking plots - LivePlot color calculations are now accurate - Go Fader now correctly respects wraparound behavior - Fixed crashes caused by non-English characters - Resolved encoder jumps when used with OSC or MIDI - Astera NYX bulbs now correctly support battery adjustments - Locked objects in LivePlot can still be selected (locking only affects Edit Mode positioning) - Turning off a Sequence Fader now correctly kills FX - Favorites Expanded filtering now works correctly - Updated UI on the Macro creation screen for improved clarity - Added a ‚Äústrong‚Äù Create New Macro ‚Äústrong‚Äù button to Macros Expanded Plus: Many additional fixes and performance improvements addressing edge cases, stability issues, and internal system reliability throughout the app. #blackoutapp #lightingconsole #lightingprogrammer ============================ Blackout Lighting Console Links: ============================= Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Join the Blackout Facebook User Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp Watch DMX Input Walkthrough youtube.com/watch?v=CZRYVAqbwGY&feature=youtu.be ============================= Ian Peterson's Links: ============================= Website: https://www.ianspeterson.com Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ian.s.peterson/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/ianpeterson

segments.text: 5 Things You Can Do with THRU in Blackout
segments.norm: 5 things you can do with thru in blackout

segments.text: It‚Äôs Syntax Sunday, and today we‚Äôre diving deep into one of the most powerful and underrated features in Blackout, the THRU key. This little keyword can do a lot more than just select a range of fixtures. In this tutorial, we‚Äôll walk through (pun intended) a bunch of creative ways to use it for gradients, timing effects, and more. Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll learn: - How to use THRU to select multiple fixtures quickly - Creating intensity gradients, from 100 through 0 or inside-out effects - Stacking THRUS for advanced lighting fades - Adding time gradients to your lighting transitions - Using THRU with color temperature, crossfades, and other parameters By the end, you‚Äôll see how THRU can make your programming faster, cleaner, and more dynamic, perfect for both small setups and large productions. Whether you‚Äôre building gradients, testing effects, or experimenting with timing, this is one syntax trick you‚Äôll use every day. Watch the full tutorial and try it in your next show. segments.text: Quick Tip: Custom OSC Command in Blackout
segments.norm: quick tip: custom osc command in blackout

segments.text: Got a quick tip for all the OSC users out there! Blackout already supports tons of built-in OSC commands (you can find the full list on our website), but did you know you can create your own custom OSC commands too? In this video, we‚Äôll show you how to set up and use custom OSC commands with Companion for Stream Deck or TouchOSC, so you can trigger anything that‚Äôs MIDI-learnable inside Blackout, from faders to cues to your Go button. Here‚Äôs how it works: -Define your command like `/blk/custom_1` in TouchOSC or Companion -In Blackout, go to Link Status ‚Üí Connect to Device ‚Üí MIDI Learn -Tap your button and assign it instantly -Add as many as you want by changing the number (custom_1, custom_2, etc.) It‚Äôs that easy, and it‚Äôs a total game-changer for customizing your workflow and getting hands-on control with Blackout. Want to learn how to set up OSC from scratch? Watch our full OSC setup tutorial on the channel. https://youtu.be/7UuzoigXD60 See how Blackout can elevate your next project and streamline your workflow. Visit www.blackout-app.com to learn more. #blackoutapp #lightingconsole #lightingprogrammer ============================ Blackout Lighting Console Links: ============================= Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Join the Blackout Facebook User Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp ============================= Ian Peterson's Links: ============================= Website: https://www.ianspeterson.com Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ian.s.peterson/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/ianpeterson

segments.text: Mastering Fader Priorities in Blackout: Quick Guide
segments.norm: mastering fader priorities in blackout: quick guide

segments.text: In this video, we‚Äôre diving into Fader Priorities in Blackout, a key concept for controlling lights efficiently on set. Whether you‚Äôre using LTP, HTP, Super, or Inhibitive faders, understanding priorities will save you time, prevent mistakes, and give you complete control over your lighting setup. We‚Äôll cover: - Fader Hierarchy in Blackout: Learn how the system prioritizes your controls and how this affects your workflow. - LTP (Latest Takes Precedence): The priority you‚Äôll use most often for smooth and responsive fader control. - High Priority Faders: Override LTP for critical lights or sequences on set. - HTP (Highest Takes Precedence): Ideal for additive transitions and rock-and-roll-style control. - Super Faders: How to lock a light at a fixed level to prevent accidental changes. - Inhibitive Faders: Set ceilings for lights, perfect for battery units or high-wattage fixtures. - Tips & Tricks: How to avoid priority conflicts, understand additive mode, and manage multiple faders across sequences. We also demonstrate real examples with a Helios tube, showing exactly how each fader type behaves and how to use them effectively on set. Pro Tip: Most of the time, you‚Äôll want to stick with LTP for faders. It‚Äôs simple, intuitive, and avoids conflicts, but knowing when and how to use High, HTP, Super, and Inhibitive faders can make the difference on complex productions. If you found this helpful, like, comment, and subscribe to stay updated on the latest Blackout tutorials. Let us know in the comments how you‚Äôre using faders on your sets and what other Blackout workflows you‚Äôd like us to cover next! Resources & Links: -Blackout Priority Hierarchy Guide: https://docs.blackout-app.com/manual/fixtures/priorityHierarchy -Jeff‚Äôs Fader Walkthrough Video: https://youtu.be/av54BhZjs3k?si=BsO3Hvsfme7OhMRP&t=830 -Relative inhibitive faders: https://youtu.be/vrPmxij3Tr8?si=F9CGWdA8y52FGfeP&t=157 -Sequence Tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K_e1mlWL13s -Blackout Official Website: www.blackout-app.com 0:00 Intro 1:08 How to Change Priority 1:20 Additive Explanation 2:10 LTP 3:20 High 5:07 HTP 7:00 Super 8:00 Inhibitive 10:16 Outro #blackoutapp #lightingconsole #lightingprogrammer ============================ Blackout Lighting Console Links: ============================= Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Join the Blackout Facebook User Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp ============================= Ian Peterson's Links: ============================= Website: https://www.ianspeterson.com Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ian.s.peterson/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/ianpeterson

segments.text: How To Link Looks & Automate Hazer Timings on Blackout
segments.norm: how to link looks & automate hazer timings on blackout

segments.text: Want your lighting looks to automatically follow one another in Blackout? In this tutorial, we‚Äôll show you how to link looks, add delays, and create seamless transitions, all with just a few clicks. First, we walk through a simple example: linking three looks so that one plays, waits a second, then fades out automatically, all from a single button press. You‚Äôll learn how to: - Expand the Looks view in Blackout - Link one look to another - Adjust default transition times in settings - Add delays and fade timings for smooth sequences Next, we cover a real-world use case: automating hazer timings. If you‚Äôve ever struggled to keep your haze level consistent, this trick makes it simple. We‚Äôll set up two looks (‚ÄúHazer On‚Äù and ‚ÄúHazer Off‚Äù), link them together, and use delays to create an automatic loop. That way you can dial in the perfect haze ratio without constantly riding the fader. Key takeaways: - Linking looks allows you to build sequences that run automatically - Delays and fades give you control over timing between cues - Hazers can be automated to run on/off cycles for consistent levels - Works for live events, film sets, or any workflow where timing matters This video also touches on sequence recording, naming conventions, and how to apply linked looks to specific fixtures. If you want to go deeper, check out our tutorial on "individual fixture timing within looks" here: https://youtu.be/dktODkgX_F0 üëâ Subscribe for more Blackout tips, and let us know in the comments what tutorials you‚Äôd like to see next.#blackoutapp #lightingconsole #lightingprogrammer ============================ Blackout Lighting Console Links: ============================= Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Join the Blackout Facebook User Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp ============================= Ian Peterson's Links: ============================= Website: https://www.ianspeterson.com Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ian.s.peterson/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/ianpeterson 00:00 Intro 00:17 Link Looks 00:35 Timing Setup 00:54 Delay & Fade 01:18 Demo Playback 01:26 Hazer Example 01:54 Record Sequence 02:29 Hazer Off 02:50 Loop Looks 03:47 Closing

segments.text: Running a Large-Scale Live Show With Blackout
segments.norm: running a large-scale live show with blackout

segments.text: The Berliner Ensemble and Beethoven Orchestra Bonn trusted Blackout to run lighting for their performance of A Song For You at the Telekom Forum. Around 120 lights were installed, and the entire show was controlled from a single iPad. This is one of the first larger-scale live shows using Blackout, and it‚Äôs a great example of how our mobile lighting console gives teams the freedom to move around while managing cues, effects, and fixtures in real time. Professional-level control doesn‚Äôt have to come from a massive system sometimes all you need is the right tools. #blackoutapp #lightingconsole #lightingprogrammer ============================ Blackout Lighting Console Links: ============================= Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Join the Blackout Facebook User Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp ============================= Follow Peter Assman: ============================= https://www.instagram.com/p.a.light/

Filter Astera lights and organize by type - Free users now indicated in Link Status with alert - Record Look with optional sequence name - New command line syntax: ‚ÄúFix 1 thru Home‚Äù will select all Fixtures - Stream Deck support in MIDI presets - Improved decimal precision in all view states & encoders - Flexible CIE x/y handling - Time/Delay support in Table View - Sequence cloning is here! üõ†Ô∏è FIXES üõ†Ô∏è - Updated OSC key mapping for fixture control - see docs.blackout-app.com for latest OSC mapping - Advanced Color Mode update similar to fixture controls (user must select the head of the fader in order to move the fader) - MIDI fixes - Fixture control panels now reset correctly when no fixtures are selected - Improved battery info retrieval for Astera fixtures - Blocked saving of empty Favorites - All faders now save properly when deleted from command ‚ÄòDelete Fader 1 thru x` - Unnumbered Astera fixtures now act as fixture 0 (command example ‚ÄúFix 0‚Äù will select all) - Show 2‚Äì20h range in DMX Configurator - Export and cloning custom views - CRMX signal now shows 0‚Äì100% instead of 0‚Äì255 - iPad mini UI fixes - OSC now shows up in MIDI Learn - Smoother encoder UI - Fixed infinite popup from hardware - Better DMX patching & pan/tilt MIDI - UI polish and improved fader handling - More stable fixture and sidebar behavior - Bug fixes and performance enhancements #blackoutapp #lightingconsole #lightingprogrammer ============================ Blackout Lighting Console Links: ============================= Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Join the Blackout Facebook User Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp ============================= Ian Peterson's Links: ============================= Website: https://www.ianspeterson.com Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ian.s.peterson/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/ianpeterson

segments.text: How to Update Blackout
segments.norm: how to update blackout

segments.text: Blackout 2.3.9 is a feature-packed update focused on giving you deeper visibility and faster control. From powerful new View States and DMX Output monitoring to smarter LivePlot tools and expanded command options, this release helps you move quicker and program smarter on set. v2.3.9 Release Notes: *FEATURE* NEW View States for seeing where values come from in Reference - Sequences and Reference - Faders *FEATURE* NEW View States for DMX Output! See your effect values in real time along with DMX input/output merges! *FEATURE* Inhibitive Faders ‚Äì toggle added for relative mode! segments.text: Blackout 2.3.8 Update: Faster Effects, Smarter UI, Better Battery
segments.norm: blackout 2.3.8 update: faster effects, smarter ui, better battery

segments.text: Blackout 2.3.8 is packed with new features and improvements. From smarter UI and MIDI updates to improved battery life and new workflow tools, this release is all about making your day on set faster and smoother. New Features: - Update effects and groups with the new update menu - Clone existing effects and apply them to new selections - View states: switch between value, decimal, DMX, time, and delay - Long-press any button to see its description - LivePlot: selection color now matches pillbox selection - Database View: collapsible folders for easier navigation - Command Line: THRU support added to collapsed keyboard - DMX Input: global toggle now in header - Display values: pan, tilt, and zoom now show degree values - Fixture Controls: dimmer, pan, and tilt always show at the top unless filtered - Advanced Color Mode: plus/minus buttons added for fine-tuning - Sequence names now sync with fader labels - Save and manage MIDI mapping presets - Learn the same command to multiple keys or devices - Keyboard popup: now larger and easier to use - Sidebar and channel UI: cleaner buttons and dropdowns - Battery life improvements on mobile and tablet devices - Full sync option in cloud database (long press Sync Database) Fixes: - Level wheel learnability improved - MIDI learning is more stable for keyboards - MIDI events no longer trigger when typing - Updating groups/effects now handles offset selections - CMD button shows in LivePlot even with keyboard open - Unnamed fixtures now render correctly - Macro popup now appears at the top of iPad - Link Status color now reflects output correctly - DMX tester now clears values on exit - Fixture Controls filters now show selected state clearly - LivePlot CCT display is harmonized across fixture ranges - General bug fixes and performance enhancements #blackoutapp #lightingconsole #lightingprogrammer ============================ Blackout Lighting Console Links: ============================= Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Join the Blackout Facebook User Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp ============================= Ian Peterson's Links: ============================= Website: https://www.ianspeterson.com Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ian.s.peterson/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/ianpeterson

segments.text: Blackout 2.3.7 adds a major workflow improvement: you can now clone and update effects directly ‚Äî no need to save and reload presets. This update is a game-changer if you're mid-shoot and need to swap fixtures, experiment with a new selection, or build variations of an existing effect without starting from scratch. You can now go from one fixture to another in just a few taps. In this video: Real-world example with a cop car effect How to clone an effect and update it to a new selection How to quickly copy parameters from one fixture to another When to use this vs. traditional presets Tips for keeping your workflow fast under pressure If you're working on set and need to make changes fast, this is for you. #blackoutapp #blackoutbreakdowns #lightingconsole #lightingprogrammer ============================ Check out what's NEW in the latest version of Blackout 2.3.7! segments.text: Introducing: The Blackout Navigator
segments.norm: introducing: the blackout navigator

segments.text: The first completely mappable OSC controller. Compatible with any lighting console. Unveiled at LDI 2024, the Navigator is Blackout's first hardware extension of the Blackout Lighting Console app. Paired with our latest software, it offers lighting professionals a dedicated, powerful tool for real-time, precise control on set. With its intuitive design, the Navigator seamlessly bridges digital control with hands-on interaction, empowering users to bring their lighting visions to life with unparalleled accuracy and efficiency. Built for Blackout, the Navigator is the first completely customizable OSC-driven hardware, making it compatible with any lighting console and enabling a versatile control experience unlike any other. ‚ú® This summer. ‚ú® ============================= Blackout Lighting Console Links: ============================= Website: https://www.blackout-app.com Online Manual: https://docs.blackout-app.com/ Help Center: https://help.blackout-app.com/ Join the Blackout Facebook User Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/blackoutapp/

segments.text: Take a look at some of the features Blackout Lighting Console has to offer: - Patch in your lights via the cloud-based fixture database - Create and manage your Groups Looks and Favorites quickly and easily using the sidebar - Intuitively control every parameter of your fixtures through Fixture Controls - Apply preset favorites or looks across groups of lights instantly - Customize your Look transitions and make adjustments to your channels blindly without affecting the live set in Looks Expanded - Create and deploy virtually any effect across any fixture type using our advanced effects engine - Create your own profiles using the custom fixture editor
